Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Bairn \Bairn\ (b[^a]rn), n. [Scot. bairn, AS. bearn, fr. beran to bear; akin to Icel., OS., & Goth. barn. See {Bear} to support.] A child. [Scot. & Prov. Eng.] [1913 Webster]
Has he not well provided for the bairn? --Beau. & Fl. [1913 Webster]
bairn n : a child: son or daughter
